intro: Hieracium sagittatum subsp. philanthracoides, commonly known as the arrowhead hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features serrated, arrowhead-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological and genetic differences from other Hieracium species.
